_header: In the Roman Acts written is thus
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘Tale of the Emperor Jereslaus,’ trans. from the Gesta Romanorum, one of several works in verse and prose that form Hoccleve’s Series, usually preceded by 508 and followed by 4879 but sometimes occurring separately—140 stanzas rhyme royal.

BodLauMis735.First Lines:
In the Romayn actus writyn is thusSometyme am Emprour in þe
                    Citee…
BodLauMis735.Last Lines:
…And lo in þis wyse and maner it seithWhich to þat
                    tale is good be knytt in feyth
BodLauMis735.Attributed Title:
Explicit dialogus et Incipit quedam fabula de quadam bona et nobili
                        Imperatrice Romana (f. 15v)

BodDig185.First Lines:
IN the Romayn Iestys wretyn is thusAum tyme an Emperour in the
                    Citee…
BodDig185.Last Lines:
…Whiche that no wyght eschue may ne fleAnd when gode wole also
                    dye schall we
BodDig185.Note:
The poem has a prosaic ‘moralisation’ at the
                    end.

BodSelSup53.First Lines:
IN romain actis writen is thusSomtime an emperour in the
                    citee…
BodSelSup53.Last Lines:
…And to in this wise and manere it seithWiche to that tale is
                    good be knytte in feith
BodSelSup53.Note:
At the end: ‘here endith þe Prolog and begynneþ þe
                    moralizing of þe …’ (the rest is under the binding). Ends
                    imperfectly due to loss of folios.

Bod221.First Lines:
IN þe Romayn actes writyn is thusSome tyme an Emperoure in
                    þe Cyte…
Bod221.Last Lines:
…And loo in þis wise and maner it seithWhich to þat
                    tale is gode be knytt in feyth
Bod221.Attributed Title:
Here endith tale of a gode woman which was sum tyme Emprice of Rome and now
                    sueth a prolog of þe moralizoun of the same tale (f. 28); Here endith
                    þe prologe and begynneth þe moralisoun (f. 28v)

BodEngPoetd4.First Lines:
IN the Romayne actus wreten is thusSome tyme an Emperour in the
                    Sitee…
BodEngPoetd4.Last Lines:
…Which that no wyht eschewe may ne ffleeAnd whane god lyst
                    also dyen shull we

BLRoy17Dvi.First Lines: In the Romayn Ieestes writen is thusSomtyme an Emperour in the Citee…
BLRoy17Dvi.Last Lines: …Which that no wight eschewe may ne fleeAnd whan god wole also dye shull we
BLRoy17Dvi.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Royal MS 17 D VI.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Royal_MS_17_D_VI.

CovAcc3251.First Lines:
IN þe Romayn Gestis wreten is thusSome tyme an Emperour in
                    þe Cete…
CovAcc3251.Last Lines:
…Which that noo wight eschewe may ne fleeAnd whanne god list
                    also a dieu shul wee
CovAcc3251.Attributed Title:
& incipit quedam fabula de quadam bona & nobile Imperatrice Romana
                    (f. 49rb); Here endithe the tale of a good woman which was sometime
                    Emperice of Rome and nowe sueth the Prolog (f. 56ra)

DULCosViii9.First Lines:
In the Roman actes writen is thusWhilom an Emperour in the
                    Citee…
DULCosViii9.Last Lines:
…Which þat no wight eschue may ne fleeAnd whan god list
                    also dye shul we
DULCosViii9.Note: Followed by a prose moralization, ff. 50 -52v.
DULCosViii9.Attributed Title:
ffabula de quadam Imperatrice Romana (f. 26v); Explicit fabula
                    de quadam Imperatrice Romana (f. 49)

Burrow,  John,  and  A. I. Doyle, eds.  
             Thomas Hoccleve: A Facsimile of the Autograph Verse
                Manuscripts.

YaleBei493.First Lines:
IN the roman actus wryttyn in thisSometyme an emperour in the
                    Citee…;
YaleBei493.Last Lines:
…And so in this wise & manere it seithWhich to þat
                    tale is good be gyng knytt in feith
YaleBei493.Note:
Tale ends, before moralization begins, ‘…Wich þat no
                    wight eschewe may ne flee / And whan god list also dye shull wee’ (f.
                        28v) Moralization begins f. 28v: ‘My frende
                    afftere y trow a wook or twoo / That þis tale endid was hoom to me
                    cam…’, followed by prose moralization.
YaleBei493.Attributed Title:
…incipit quedam fabula de quadam et nobile imperatrice Romana
                    (f. 16v); Here endith my tale of a good woman which was In tyme
                    Emprice of Rome and now sewyth a prologg þe moralizasion of þe same
                    tale (f. 28v); Here endith þe moralizing of my tale… (f.
                    30)
